text: Jesse Willard "Pete" Carr (April 22, 1950 â€“ June 27, 2020) was an American guitarist and record producer. Carr was born in Daytona Beach, Florida. Carr worked with Joan Baez, Luther Ingram, Bob Seger, Joe Cocker, Boz Scaggs, Paul Simon, The Staple Singers, Rod Stewart, Barbra Streisand, Wilson Pickett, Hank Williams, Jr., among many others, over forty years. Carr co-produced Seger's Stranger in Town album which featured the hit "Old Time Rock and Roll". Carr died on June 27, 2020 in Florence, Alabama at the age of 70.Legendary Muscle Shoals guitarist Pete Carr dead at 70 ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American rock guitarists Category:American record producers Category:Musicians from Florida Category:Businesspeople from Florida Category:People from Daytona Beach, Florida
title: Pete Carr
